translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Gandhodaka
“Having gone to the forest, the grove,
having made a stupa on the sand,
I offered it to the Buddha.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
In one eon, twenty-four eons ago,
there was one who removed darkness,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Punnaga Flower recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā punnāgapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Punnāgapupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā punnāgapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽punnāgapupphiya therassa apadānam
translated: The Birth Story of the Elder Punnaga Flower is the third.
